intro: Hymenolepis gnidioides, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and palmately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in woodland or forest understories. Its flowers are hermaphroditic, meaning they contain both male and female reproductive structures. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties, with various parts used in traditional medicine.
